article: The Jordans had the best raspberries in the neighborhood, and that their bushes were always heavy with fruit.So, that summer Friday night, we snuck into the Jordans' backyard and _ ourselves carefully around the bushes and started _ their sweet, juicy berry. And we were enjoying every bite of ill-gotten berry _ all of a sudden the Jordans' backyard lights were turned on. "What you boys doing out here?" Mr Jordan shouted. In all _ ran off my friends, une aten raspberries _ everywhere. He made an attempt to grab one or two, but they were too quick. Speed was never my _ . So I could just stand there and _ whatever punishment from the Jordans and my parents. I took the scolding that Mr Jordan gave me until we reached my house, where my mother took over . My friends said they could hear every _ word from the darkness of our backyard, where they had gathered to celebrate their _ . They _ me about it for days afterwards, while all I could do was complain about how _ it was that I had to pay the full _ for doing the exact same thing all of them had done without any _ consequences. After about a week, I complained it to my father. "You took raspberries without asking, and you got exactly the punishment you _ ,"Dad said. "But what about the other guys?" I asked. "That's not my _ , nor should it be yours," Dad said. "You can't control what happens to other people. You can _ deal with what happens to you." Back then I thought Dad just didn't _ it. But through the years I come to realize that, as usual , he knew what he was talking about. We didn't come to earth with a(an) _ that life would treat us fairly. The only thing we can actually deal with is what happens to us.
